channel.title: Rate my site, need opinions
channel.description:
http://rigibore.com
Designed and developed from scratch, all graphics, scripting, PHP, the lot is done by me (except the orbit slideshow on the home page). I heavily regret not using a CSS framework, but I've tried to optimise every piece of code as well as possible, as well as using load time tools to get optimum speeds.
For those interested, some of the design work, using the [url=http://960.gs/]960 grid[/url] PSD template:
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/585/91026754.png/][IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img585/9599/91026754.th.png[/img][/URL]
Edit 1st May: lots of changes, modified links, site went live march 22nd.
[ul][li]Spanish site is now fully operational, this was a massive rework of the code.[/li] [li]Technical info page added, snazzy jquery and mysql data selection.[/li] [li]Navigation bar now scrolls with the page.[/li] [li]Sliding down jquery effects for the navigation drop downs instead of the old 'just appearing' drop downs.[/li] [li][url=http://rigibore.com/activeedge.php]ActiveEdge page[/url] completely reworked, hover over the parts on the component![/li] [li]Removed the enquiry form on the product pages and slapped it in the nav bar (only appears on relevant pages).[/li][/ul]

item.title: Rate my site, need opinions
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:28, topic:508197”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=626436.msg4291894#msg4291894 date=1367444539]

You should dev a new homepage for this site

If somebody gave me a design I’d be happy to do all the actual scripting I’m useless with the design stages.
[/quote]
Myself and Moparisthebest said the exact same thing! I think a lot of people are the same, I lack creative design big time but I could write code all day long.[/quote]

I’ll design it. MWHAHAHAHA.

OT: Site looks nice! Good work. Yay for CSS3 transitions!

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my site, need opinions
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:508197”]I really like it, if it’s from scratch that’s very impressive

A few notes:
The sitemap links just seem a bit strange to me, especially when hovering
Personally I think the orange on light blue for the news section at the bottom would just be better full white
Find higher resolution images for your slideshow[/quote]
From scratch, all done with notepad++, my trusty editor.

Was more of a showcase of basic CSS3 transitions, do you not like them? :o Or are you referring to the general layout of the sitemap etc?
Will play with the colours on the news links.
HD images were noted in the OP.

eyeownyew:

Just curious, why do you use PS instead of inDesign? I find inDesign to be much better for creating designs with a hierarchical grid

Basically, lack of experience with InDesign.
I did work experience with a small web design/development company around 5 years ago for high school, and I found that they really only used InDesign for print work, posters, leaflets, etc. Never really considered it, I’ve got a lot of experience with Photoshop and I’ve found it does everything I need, except vector drawing, for that I’ll use Illustrator.

RSCShadow:

Looks very professional and clean. I’d just recommend adding some sort of delay/fade to the dropdowns but other than that, it’s great.

Thank you yes definitely, did consider using a simple jQuery slideDown() on the hover pseudo element, never really got around to it, will do when I’m next at work.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my site, need opinions
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:14, topic:508197”][quote author=Mikeyzzz link=topic=626436.msg4260197#msg4260197 date=1363392326]
How much you getting paid?
[/quote]
It’s for the company I work for, I joined as a software developer almost a year ago, but occasionally he would ask me to add bits to the existing website, which was really a massive task, the existing website uses tables nested 7 levels deep, a developer’s nightmare
So I said basically it’s the worst website I have ever seen, script wise, and offered to redesign it completely.

tl;dr, I’m on an hourly wage, saves having strict deadlines etc.

For those interested, some of the design work, using the 960 grid PSD template:

[/quote]I respect employees like you.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my site, need opinions
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:11, topic:508197”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=626436.msg4260181#msg4260181 date=1363391763]
Great work, cj. I like this, and the colors seem just right for an engineering-themed site.
Only thing that urks me is that white space on top of the phone numbers in the top right corner.
A personal suggestion of mine is to split your support box in half and put in a randomly generated testimonials preview. Might just be me, but I like sites that offer testimonials on the home page.
[/quote]
Sure, thank you. Definitely agree with the blank space, header isn’t really finalised yet, as I didn’t know what to put there. I did have a separate testimonials page, although it is yet to be started, it probably would be an idea to just have it just as an element on a page or pages.
Possibly have a select few testimonials in a handwriting style light grey font above the phone numbers, and have them fade into each statement? Just an idea.[/quote]
I’ve never liked testimonials being the first thing I see. It gives me the idea that the company is overconfident, in a sense. Putting it next to the support column shows the quality of your goods/services.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my site, need opinions
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:508197”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=626436.msg4260150#msg4260150 date=1363390287]
I actually like it a lot, I can’t flaw it at all. I’m actually looking for a new place to order some inserts from and if the prices aren’t bad I’d actually consider ordering from here. It’s a lot better than the other sites I’ve seen the purchasers at work using.

I like the RPM calculator as well, it could be useful for inexperienced turners or those just curious. Great job, CJ!
[/quote]
No way, you work in the engineering industry?

Cheers Ruby, only a simple bit of JavaScript I whipped up
And yeah I found engineering sites in general are, to put it bluntly, absolute shite in terms of design. Only decent ones I found are some of our competitors, http://www.kennametal.com/ and http://www.sandvik.com/en/[/quote]
Yeah, I’m an environmental engineer to trade which more or less qualifies me as an electro-mechanical engineer so I’m always looking for good cheap buys to give to the purchasers to get on their good side haha.

The Kennametal one doesn’t seem too bad, sandvik is a bit bland. I’ve definitely seen worse though, there’s a few completely monstrous ones haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my site, need opinions
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Mikeyzzz:

Hide your directories, I don’t know how to hide them, but I just accessed them.

I know, I don’t mind, it’s only a temporary host. I can easily hide them with some .htaccess files.

[quote=“jal knight, post:2, topic:508197”]You made all of this from scratch by yourself?..

:o holy shit… it’s awesome. I think it doesnt appeal to you because you’ve spent so muchtime making it.[/quote]
Really? Thanks And yeah, from scratch, graphics and all.

Si Force:

I’m not much of a critic but the picture slider moves on to the next picture a bit too fast. Just something that slightly annoyed me personally. Otherwise, I don’t see much wrong.

Yeah that’s a quick fix and I’d agree, the slideshow is really just a placeholder until my boss gives me some higher quality photos, cheers

Read full topic
